revised_title: Evolution of Climatic Variability in the North Atlantic Region Over the Past Three Million Years
tldr: This article discusses the evolution of climatic variability in the North Atlantic region over the past three million years. It highlights the different climatic regimes during the Matuyama and Gauss chron periods and explores the possible tectonic connections behind these changes. The study focuses on non-isotopic indicators, such as oxygen-isotope ratios, continental detritus, and sea-surface temperature, to analyze the impact of ice sheets on the climate.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Climate Science
